column4: This represents the concept that some bulbs are used more frequently than others in a house.
Curve is of the form: h(t) = - Ln(X)
This calibration scaler is used to calibrate the model to so that it provides a particular average output over a large number of runs.

column9: Assumption: India has fewer light bulbs per house but as more are added their efficiency
improves. Hence total lighting electricity remains constant at about 27.5% of UK.

column4: Effective occupancy represents the sharing of light use.

column5: U.S. Department of Energy, Energy Information Administration, 1993 Residential Energy Consumption Survey,
Mean Annual Electricity Consumption for Lighting, by Family Income by Number of Household Members

column4: This model defines how long a bulb will stay on for, if a switch-on event occurs.

column5: M. Stokes, M. Rylatt, K. Lomas, A simple model of domestic lighting demand, Energy and Buildings 36 (2004) 103-116
